result: The panoptic is an idea of ​​discipline that can be applied in contemporary societies, preferably exercised by mechanisms. A) Religious, which constitutes a divine eye controlling that sees everything. B) Ideological, which sets limits by alienation, preventing the view of the dominion suffered. C) Repressive, perpetuating the relations of dominion among men through physical torture. D) Subtle, which trains the bodies in space-time through the look as a control instrument. E) Consensual, which agrees to agree on the understanding of the general benefits of having their own controlled actions.
